child.pub-comments: "The position of Bobo-fing (Sya) remains tentative. ... Miss Mary Lynn Morse (who has done the only substantial work on Bobo-fing, and reporting by personal communication) suggests that Bob-fing represents the earliest dichotomy within the Mande languages, coordinate with the totality of the subdivisions outlined above. Her construction, which appears reasonable, would divide the Mande languages into two major categories: A: Bobo-fing, and B: the rest of Mande as outlined above." (p. 116)
child.publications: Welmers, William E. 1971. Niger-Congo, Mande. In Linguistics in Sub-Saharan Africa, Current Trends in Linguistics, vol. 7, 113-139. The Hague: Mouton.
